intro: Stemodia hyptoides var. platensis, commonly known as the broadleaf stemodia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are often pubescent, giving the plant a slightly hairy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
